main event: A bright star-like object was sighted hovering and then disappearing in Woodridge, New York in July 1962.
interesting points: The object was observed for about 10 minutes,The object was first seen in the east and hovered at about a 75-degree elevation in the northeast,The light was described as brighter than the stars and was the only object visible in that part of the sky,The observer noted that there was no sound associated with the object,The sighting was reported by a school teacher who expressed a keen interest in unidentified phenomena.
witness description: A school teacher with an interest in scientific phenomena
